awe6.interfaces.IInputManager

type
interface
The IInputManager interface should be implemented by an object wishing to provide user input states to the kernel.

The state machine represents the configuration of the input devices at any specific update frame.

State based input is useful for many types of game mechanics, including: momentum, instant replays and special move combos.

Instance Variables

joypad(default,null) : IInputJoypad

The default virtual joypad user input: simple 4 directional controller with 2 fire buttons. Listens to cursor keys and WASD keys.

keyboard(default,null) : IInputKeyboard

The virtual keyboard user input: every key on the keyboard.

mouse(default,null) : IInputMouse

The virtual mouse user input: 3 button mouse and scroll wheel.

Instance Methods

createJoypad( ?up : EKey, ?right : EKey, ?down : EKey, ?left : EKey, ?primary : EKey, ?secondary : EKey, ?upAlt : EKey, ?rightAlt : EKey, ?downAlt : EKey, ?leftAlt : EKey, ?primaryAlt : EKey, ?secondaryAlt : EKey ) : IInputJoypad

parameters
?up The key for up directional movement. Defaults to up cursor.
?right The key for right directional movement. Defaults to right cursor.
?down The key for down directional movement. Defaults to down cursor.
?left The key for left directional movement. Defaults to left cursor.
?primary The key for primary fire. Defaults to space.
?secondary The key for secondary fire. Defaults to Z key.
?upAlt Optional alternative key for up directional movement.
?rightAlt Optional alternative key for right directional movement.
?downAlt Optional alternative key for down directional movement.
?leftAlt Optional alternative key for left directional movement.
?primaryAlt Optional alternative key for primary fire.
?secondaryAlt Optional alternative key for secondary fire.
returns
A virtual joypad with custom key controls.
Factory method to create a virtual joypad with custom key controls.

reset( ) : Void

Resets the state of all virtual input devices (e.g. keys down duration, mouse velocities etc).
